snippet: The State Department seizes an opportunity to showcase American cuisine, particularly local ingredients.
abstract: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton has transformed the way food is chosen, cooked and served at the State Department's Foggy Bottom headquarters, and she has given it prominence as an important part of diplomacy; meals for heads of state and other foreign dignitaries are used as an opportunity to showcase American cuisine, particularly local ingredients, and to show fluency in the visitors’ culinary traditions.
lead_paragraph: The State Department seizes an opportunity to showcase American cuisine, particularly local ingredients.

headline.seo: Secretary of State Transforms the Diplomatic Menu
headline.main: Diplomacy Travels on Its Stomach, Too
